clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Results After Sleeve Gastrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Results After Sleeve Gastrectomy as a Primary Procedure in Obesity Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Today sleeve gastrectomy is the most performed bariatric procedure worldwide. Since 2005 it is gaining popularity as a single procedure. Long term data is scarce. In this retrospective study long term follow-up in relation to weight loss, comorbidities, re-do and revisional surgery is getting analyzed.

detailed_description.textblock:
Today sleeve gastrectomy is the most performed bariatric procedure worldwide. Since 2005 it is gaining popularity as a single procedure. Long term data is scarce.
Re-Do and revisional surgery in form of re-sleeve, gastric bypass (mini -gastric bypass, roux-en y gastric bypass) and biliopancreatic diversion (BPD) is described in the current literature due to weight regain and reflux. The investigators want to analyze the frequency of this re-do/revisional surgery and want to compare weight loss and improvement in comorbidities.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy since 2007, being the first szrgical treatment for severe obesity are studied in the long term follow-up
